intro: Calamus ulur, commonly known as the river sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often near rivers or in swampy areas. Its slender, grass-like stems are often used in traditional crafts and basket weaving. The flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
